Understate: The claim may understate the fact that women have served as press secretary and communications director simultaneously in the Trump administration, which are considered senior communications positions.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by not acknowledging that women have held senior communications roles in the Trump administration.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to fully establish that the Biden administration will have the first senior White House communications team entirely composed of women, as there have been women in similar roles in the Trump administration.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the designation of seven women in top-ranking communications jobs by the Biden transition team is the first time in presidential history, without considering previous administrations.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation to the claim, as conservative media and members of President Trump's press team argue that Trump was actually the first president to have all women in leading communications roles.
